Metadata.Title: Use element.textContent to Assign Values to DOM Elements
Metadata.DirectLink: Use element.textContent to Assign Values to DOM Elements

Content.Data:
==Applies To==
* HTML5
==What to Do==
Use the //textContent// method instead of //innerHTML// to assign values to DOM elements.
==Why==
Using the //textContent// method instead of innerHTML prevents cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks, because values assigned using //textContent// will not be executed as script.
==How==
To use the //textContent// property instead of //innerHTML//:
# **Find all references to //innerHTML//.** Search the application code for all references to the //innerHTML// property. Create a spreadsheet to list all code that uses the //innerHTML// property to assign values to DOM elements. # **Use //textContent// instead of //innerHTML//.** Using the spreadsheet as a guide, for all code that uses //innerHTML// to assign values, change it to use //textContent// instead. Simply replace references to //innerHTML// with //textContent//. For most applications, no further changes should be required.
